trans-unit.source: <properties pageTitle="App requirements for Azure RemoteApp" description="Learn about the requirements for apps that you want to use in Azure RemoteApp" services="remoteapp" documentationCenter="" authors="lizap" manager="mbaldwin" />
trans-unit.target: <properties pageTitle="App requirements for Azure RemoteApp" description="Learn about the requirements for apps that you want to use in Azure RemoteApp" services="remoteapp" documentationCenter="" authors="lizap" manager="mbaldwin" />

trans-unit.source: <tags ms.service="remoteapp" ms.workload="compute" ms.tgt_pltfrm="na" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="08/12/2015" ms.author="elizapo" />
trans-unit.target: <tags ms.service="remoteapp" ms.workload="compute" ms.tgt_pltfrm="na" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="08/12/2015" ms.author="elizapo" />

trans-unit.source: Azure RemoteApp supports streaming 32-bit or 64-bit Windows-based applications from a Windows Server 2012 R2 image.
trans-unit.target: Azure RemoteApp supports streaming 32-bit or 64-bit Windows-based applications from a Windows Server 2012 R2 image.

trans-unit.source: Most existing 32-bit or 64-bit Windows-based applications run "as is" in Azure RemoteApp (Remote Desktop Services or formerly known as Terminal Services) environment.
trans-unit.target: Most existing 32-bit or 64-bit Windows-based applications run "as is" in Azure RemoteApp (Remote Desktop Services or formerly known as Terminal Services) environment.

trans-unit.source: However, there is a difference between running and running well - some applications function correctly and perform well, while others do not.
trans-unit.target: However, there is a difference between running and running well - some applications function correctly and perform well, while others do not.

trans-unit.source: The following information provides guidance for developing applications in a Remote Desktop Services environment and testing to ensure compatibility.
trans-unit.target: The following information provides guidance for developing applications in a Remote Desktop Services environment and testing to ensure compatibility.

trans-unit.source: Tip: We're working on creating some working examples of apps for you.
trans-unit.target: Tip: We're working on creating some working examples of apps for you.

trans-unit.source: You'll see new topics that discuss using Microsoft Access, QuickBooks, and App-V in RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: You'll see new topics that discuss using Microsoft Access, QuickBooks, and App-V in RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: These three requirements, if followed, help your application run well in RemoteApp:
trans-unit.target: These three requirements, if followed, help your application run well in RemoteApp:

trans-unit.source: Applications that meet all <linkText>Certification requirements for Windows desktop apps</linkText><title></title> and adhere to <linkText>Remote Desktop Services programming guidelines</linkText><title></title> will have complete compatibility with RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: Applications that meet all <linkText>Certification requirements for Windows desktop apps</linkText><title></title> and adhere to <linkText>Remote Desktop Services programming guidelines</linkText><title></title> will have complete compatibility with RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: Applications should never store data locally on the image or RemoteApp instances that can be lost.
trans-unit.target: Applications should never store data locally on the image or RemoteApp instances that can be lost.

trans-unit.source: After you create a RemoteApp collection, the instances are cloned and are stateless and should only contain applications.
trans-unit.target: After you create a RemoteApp collection, the instances are cloned and are stateless and should only contain applications.

trans-unit.source: Store data in an external source or within the user's profile.
trans-unit.target: Store data in an external source or within the user's profile.

trans-unit.source: Custom images should never contain data that can be lost.
trans-unit.target: Custom images should never contain data that can be lost.

trans-unit.source: Use these steps to testing applications:
trans-unit.target: Use these steps to testing applications:

trans-unit.source: Install Windows Server 2012 R2 and your application
trans-unit.target: Install Windows Server 2012 R2 and your application

trans-unit.source: Enable Remote Desktop
trans-unit.target: Enable Remote Desktop

trans-unit.source: Create two user accounts, UserA and UserB, adding both user accounts to the Remote Desktop security group.
trans-unit.target: Create two user accounts, UserA and UserB, adding both user accounts to the Remote Desktop security group.

trans-unit.source: Check multi-session compatibility by establishing two simultaneous RDS sessions to the PC while launching the application.
trans-unit.target: Check multi-session compatibility by establishing two simultaneous RDS sessions to the PC while launching the application.

trans-unit.source: Validate app behavior
trans-unit.target: Validate app behavior

trans-unit.source: Use the following guidelines for developing applications for RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: Use the following guidelines for developing applications for RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: Installing an <linkText>application for a single user </linkText><title></title>can create problems in a multiuser environment.
trans-unit.target: Installing an <linkText>application for a single user </linkText><title></title>can create problems in a multiuser environment.

trans-unit.source: Applications should <linkText>store user-specific information</linkText><title></title> in user-specific locations, separately from global information that applies to all users.
trans-unit.target: Applications should <linkText>store user-specific information</linkText><title></title> in user-specific locations, separately from global information that applies to all users.

trans-unit.source: RemoteApp uses multiple <linkText>namespaces for kernel objects</linkText><title></title>; a global namespace is used primarily by services in client/server applications.
trans-unit.target: RemoteApp uses multiple <linkText>namespaces for kernel objects</linkText><title></title>; a global namespace is used primarily by services in client/server applications.

trans-unit.source: It is not safe to assume that the computer name or the <linkText>IP address</linkText><title></title> assigned to the computer are associated with a single user because multiple users can be logged on simultaneously to a Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server.
trans-unit.target: It is not safe to assume that the computer name or the <linkText>IP address</linkText><title></title> assigned to the computer are associated with a single user because multiple users can be logged on simultaneously to a Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server.

trans-unit.source: Disable <linkText>graphic effects</linkText><title></title> before you add your app to RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: Disable <linkText>graphic effects</linkText><title></title> before you add your app to RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: To maximize CPU availability for all users, either disable <linkText>background tasks </linkText><title></title> or create efficient background tasks that are not resource-intensive.
trans-unit.target: To maximize CPU availability for all users, either disable <linkText>background tasks </linkText><title></title> or create efficient background tasks that are not resource-intensive.

trans-unit.source: You should tune and balance application <linkText>thread usage</linkText><title></title> for a multiuser, multiprocessor environment.
trans-unit.target: You should tune and balance application <linkText>thread usage</linkText><title></title> for a multiuser, multiprocessor environment.

trans-unit.source: To optimize performance, it is good practice for applications to <linkText>detect</linkText><title></title> whether they are running in a client session.
trans-unit.target: To optimize performance, it is good practice for applications to <linkText>detect</linkText><title></title> whether they are running in a client session.
